AssetClass.title: Asset Class
AssetClass.description: As defined by CFI code: ISO 10962 (2015); Character #2

InstrumentType.title: Instrument Type
InstrumentType.description: As defined by CFI code: ISO 10962 (2015); Character #1

UseCase.title: Use Case
UseCase.description: Unique label that defines the product

Level.title: Level
Level.description: Label assigned to the ISIN to describe its level in the hierarchy

elaboration.New: New ISIN added to the database
elaboration.Updated: One/several of the fields in the ISIN record is/are updated
elaboration.Deleted: The instrument associated with the ISIN is no longer active
elaboration.Reused: ISIN that exists in inactive ISIN record in ASB database is used in an Active ISIN record

LongName.title: Full Name
LongName.description: Full name of the financial instrument

CFI.title: Classification Type
CFI.description: Indicates the type of security using ISO 10962 standard, Classification of Financial Instruments (CFI code) values. ISO 10962 is maintained by ANNA (Association of National Numbering Agencies) acting as Registration Authority

CommoditiesDerivativesIndicator.title: Commodity Derivative Indicator
CommoditiesDerivativesIndicator.description: Indication as to whether the financial instrument falls within the definition of commodities derivative under Article 2(1)(30) of Regulation (EU) No 600/2014 or is a derivative relating to emission allowances referred to in Section C(4) of Annex I to Directive 2014/65/EU

Issuer.title: Issuer or Operator of the Trading Venue Identifier

FISN.title: Short Name
FISN.description: Short name of financial instrument in accordance with ISO 18774

PriceMultiplier.title: Price Multiplier
PriceMultiplier.description: Number of units of the underlying instrument represented by a single derivative contract. Number of units of the underlying instrument represented by a single derivative contract. For an option on an index, the amount per index point. For spreadbets the movement in the price of the underlying instrument on which the spreadbet is based

UnderlyingAssetType.title: Underlying Asset Type
UnderlyingAssetType.description: The type of the underlying asset as defined by CFI code: ISO 10962 (2015)

ReturnPayout.title: Return or Payout Trigger
ReturnPayout.description: The Return or payout Trigger as defined by CFI code: ISO 10962 (2015)

elaboration.Price: price return equity swap, similar to a total return swap, except that dividends are not passed through to the buyer
elaboration.Dividend: a fixed-term contract between two parties where one party will make an interest rate payment for each interval and the other party will pay the total dividends received as pay-out by a selected underlying asset
elaboration.Variance: a forward swap that uses the variance (being the volatility squared) of an underlying's price movement over a period as the basis for the payoff calculation
elaboration.Volatility: the variability of movements in a security or underlying instrument's price; it is a measure of the amount by which an asset's price is expected to fluctuate over a given period of time; it is normally measured by the annual standard deviation of daily price changes
elaboration.Total Return: the total economic return of an underlying asset is transferred from one party (total return buyer) to another (total return seller); total return seller takes on the risk of negative changes in market value of the reference asset, and pays any positive cash flow to the buyer such as coupon, capital gains or dividends of the reference asset
elaboration.Contract for Difference (CFD): a cash settled total return swap or forward where the parties agree to exchange on the maturity of the contract the difference between the opening price and closing price of the underlying
elaboration.Spreadbets: the payout is determined by the movement in the reference price of the underlying instrument to its price at expiry (or the price when the holder wishes to close out) multiplied by an agreed amount per point movement

DeliveryType.title: Delivery Type
DeliveryType.description: The Delivery Type as defined by CFI code: ISO 10962 (2015)

elaboration.Cash: the discharge of an obligation by payment or receipt of a net cash amount instead of payment or delivery by both parties
elaboration.Physical: the meeting of a settlement obligation under a derivative contract through the receipt or delivery of the actual underlying instrument(s) instead of through cash settlement

ISOUnderlyingInstrumentReferenceRate.title: ISO Underlying Instrument Index
ISOUnderlyingInstrumentReferenceRate.description: Underlying Instrument Index represented in ISO 20022 acceptable format

elaboration.AU-FIB: Australian Semi-Government Securities Fixed Interest Bonds
elaboration.AU-FRB: Australian Government Securities Fixed Rate Bonds
elaboration.AU-ILB: Australian Semi-Government Securities Index Linked Bonds
elaboration.AU-TAB: Australian Government Securities Treasury Adjustable Rate Bonds
elaboration.BE-REGIONGT: Public sector issues guaranteed by Regional Authorities
elaboration.BE-STATEGT: Public sector issues guaranteed by the Belgian State
elaboration.CA-RRB: Government of Canada Real Return Bonds
elaboration.DE-ERBLAST: Negotiable Debt Obligations issued by or taken over and since serviced and managed by the Erblasttilgungsfond (Redemption Fund for Inherited Liabilities) backed by Federal Republic of Germany, including but not limited to former issues of the Treuhandanstalt, the Bundesbahn, the Bundespost, the Economic Recovery Program (ERP), the privatised Federal Railway (Bahn AG), the telecommunications element of the Federal Post Office (Telekom) and the German Unity Fund
elaboration.ES-EQUITY: Equity securities issued by a Spanish company, and listed as an IBEX 35 constituent company as reported by the Sociedad de Bolsas, each share representing the minimum unit of participation of a shareholder in the stock capital of the company
elaboration.FR-BTAN: Treasury Notes: Bons du Tresor a Taux Annuel (BTAN)
elaboration.FR-BTF: Treasury Bills: Bons du Tresor a Taux Fixe (BTF)
elaboration.FR-OAT: Government bonds: Obligations Assimilables du Tresor (OAT)

elaboration.GA-EUROZONE-GOV: Generally Accepted Euro Zone Government Securities
elaboration.GA-HK-GOV: Generally Accepted Hong Kong Government Obligations
elaboration.GA-NZ-GOV: Generally Accepted New Zealand Government Obligations
elaboration.GB-ZEROGILT: Gilt Strips or Zero Coupon Gilts
elaboration.HK-BILL: Hong Kong Government Exchange Fund Bills
elaboration.HK-NOTE: Hong Kong Government Exchange Fund Notes
elaboration.IT-BOT: Botbuoni Ordinari del Tesoro (BOT) zero coupon debt securities issued by the Italian Treasury with maturities up to 365 days
elaboration.IT-BTP: Buoni del Tesoro Poliennali fixed interest semi-annual debt securities issued by the Italian Treasury with original maturities between 3 and 30 years
elaboration.IT-CCT: Certificati di Credito del Tesoro a Cedola Variable (CCT) or floating rate interest bearing debt securities issued by the Italian Treasury
elaboration.IT-CTZ: Certificati del Tesoro zero coupon debt securities issued by the Italian Treasury with maturities between 18 and 24 months
elaboration.IT-REP: Debt securities issued and marketed by the Republic of Italy outside the Italian market, traded as Eurobonds
elaboration.JP-EQUITY: Equity securities issued by a Japanese company, each share representing the minimum unit of participation of a partner in the stock capital of the company
elaboration.KR-EXIM: Non Korean Won denominated Export-Import Bank of Korea bonds
elaboration.KR-KDICKRW: Korean Development Insurance Corporation Bonds (Korean Won denominated)
elaboration.KR-KDR: Non-Korean Won denominated Korea Development Bank bonds (KDBs)
elaboration.KR-NHC: Non Korean Won denominated Korea National Housing Corporation bonds (KNHCs)
elaboration.KR-ROK: Non-Korean Won denominated Republic of Korea bonds (ROKs)
elaboration.SU-IBRDDN: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (World Bank) Discount Notes
elaboration.SU-IBRDGB: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (World Bank or IBRD) Global Benchmark Bonds

elaboration.US-FHLMCMBS: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation Certificates - Mortgage Backed Securities

NotionalCurrency.title: Notional Currency
NotionalCurrency.description: Currency in which the notional is denominated. Usage: Within MiFIR, in the case of an interest rate or currency derivative contract, this will be the notional currency of leg 1 or the currency 1 of the pair. Within MiFIR, in the case of swaptions where the underlying swap is single-currency, this will be the notional currency of the underlying swap. For swaptions where the underlying is multi-currency, this will be the notional currency of leg 1 of the swap

UnderlyingIndexName.title: Underlying Instrument Index
UnderlyingIndexName.description: Name of the index on which the financial instrument is based
